html.p: For a non-negative integer [mathjaxinline]n[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline] is defined to be the set

tr.td: [mathjax]\left\{ \left[\begin{array}{c} a_1 \\ a_2 \\ \vdots \\ a_ n \end{array} \right] \ : \ a_1, a_2, \ldots a_ n \in \mathbb R\right\} .[/mathjax]

html.p: With addition and scalar multiplication as defined previously, [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline] is an example of a vector space over the field [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R[/mathjaxinline].
